description: MHD Riemann problem initial conditions from Balsara (2001). These are standard test problems for MHD solvers. The 1D problems are solved in the x-direction with Bx = const.
reference: Balsara, D.S. (2001). Total Variation Diminishing Scheme for Adiabatic and Isothermal Magnetohydrodynamics. J. Comput. Phys., 174, 614-648. DOI: 10.1006/jcph.2001.6918
note: Balsara MHD tests use gamma=2.0 unless otherwise noted. State vectors: [rho, vx, vy, vz, p, Bx, By, Bz]. Bx is constant across the interface.

test1.name: Brio-Wu shock tube (modified)
test1.description: Modified Brio-Wu problem. Produces fast rarefaction, slow compound wave, contact, slow shock, fast rarefaction.

test3.name: Balsara Test 3
test3.description: Strong blast in magnetized medium. Tests strong shock capturing.

test4.name: Balsara Test 4
test4.description: Bx=0 reduces to hydrodynamic + transverse B. Tests degenerate cases.

test5.name: Balsara Test 5
test5.description: General oblique MHD Riemann problem with all wave families present.
